attachments.title: Moves main.go and core.yaml under the peer folder by srderson · Pull Request #1165 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: This PR moves main.go and core.yaml under the peer folder to address issue #1131. The goal is to remove the need for the -o peer flag when compiling. I have updated all documentation. @rameshthoom...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Moves main.go and core.yaml under the peer folder by srderson · Pull Request #1165 · hyperledger/fabric

text: ok. will update my travis.yml script after you merge the code.
Binh will merge. I’ll ask him to contact you when he does so. Let me know if you have any questions
ok
I think we need to take the following out of the travis.yml

branches:
  only:
  - master
so that it builds when anyone submits a PR
not just when it is merged
<@U11HH3P7Y>: agree?
Chris, Travis triggers the build if PR or Push (merge) request comes to the master branch
I also noticed there are still a lot of obc references in travis.yml. Do those need to be updated?
Sheehan, I have updated my travis.yml file and it's working those changes in my forked repo.. Will submit PR tomorrow morning.
thanks
